title: Fix header readability with proper contrast on all devices

requirements.summary: Add a dark background color to the header section in HeaderNav.tsx to ensure proper contrast against white text
acceptanceCriteria: Header has a dark background color that provides sufficient contrast for light text
Background color is consistent across all viewport sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop)
The dark background does not conflict with the sticky header behavior

file_operations.description: Add a dark background color to the header element to provide proper contrast for light text. Apply the background using Tailwind classes that work with the existing color system defined in tailwind.config.js. Ensure the background color is applied to the sticky header container and remains consistent across all viewport sizes without affecting the existing sticky positioning behavior.

requirements.summary: Ensure the name 'Sheik Tonmoy Islam' in the header is clearly visible and readable against the new dark background on all devices
acceptanceCriteria: The name 'Sheik Tonmoy Islam' has sufficient color contrast against the dark header background
Text is readable on mobile devices (320px+), tablets, and desktop screens
Font weight and size ensure readability without strain

file_operations.description: Ensure the name 'Sheik Tonmoy Islam' displayed in the header (currently rendered as a Link to '/') uses appropriate text color classes that provide sufficient contrast against the new dark background. Verify font weight and size are adequate for readability across all device sizes. Use Tailwind text color utilities that contrast well with the dark background applied in REQ-1.

requirements.summary: Ensure all navigation menu items in the header are clearly visible and readable against the new dark background on all devices
acceptanceCriteria: All navigation menu items have sufficient color contrast against the dark header background
Menu items are readable in both desktop navigation and mobile sheet menu
Active route highlighting remains visible with the new color scheme
Hover states for menu items provide clear visual feedback

file_operations.description: Update text colors for all navigation menu items (Home, About, Services, Skills, Portfolio, Blog, Contact) to ensure sufficient contrast against the new dark header background. This includes both the desktop navigation links and the mobile sheet menu items. Verify that the active route highlighting (currently using text-primary) remains visible and distinguishable with the new color scheme. Ensure hover states provide clear visual feedback using appropriate color utilities from the Tailwind configuration.

requirements.summary: Verify header displays perfectly and remains readable across all device sizes including mobile (320px+), tablet, and desktop viewports
acceptanceCriteria: Header layout and text remain readable on screens from 320px width up to large desktop sizes
No text overflow or layout breaking occurs at any standard viewport size
Mobile menu sheet displays with proper contrast and readability
Sticky header behavior works correctly on all device sizes

file_operations.description: Review and test the header component to ensure all layout, spacing, and text rendering work correctly across device sizes from 320px width upward. Verify that the sticky header behavior (top-0 sticky z-50) functions properly on all viewport sizes. Ensure the mobile sheet menu maintains proper contrast and readability with the new dark background color scheme. Check that no text overflow or layout breaking occurs at any breakpoint, and that both the logo/name and navigation items remain properly aligned and visible.
